Dear XXXXXX



I am a student of course XXXXX, I and my classmates got some questions on the remaining lessons and the examination.



First of all, we hear some rumours about the examination will be arranged as planned, in the beginning of January 2020. We doubt whether the cancelled and the remaining classes could be finished on time.



For the reasons of doubt, there’s around one month from tomorrow, 27 Nov 2019 to the beginning of Jan 2020, but there are 5-7 lessons left for most of the modules. And I suppose every single student takes 3-4 modules a semester. How could you, the top management arrange such a number of lessons in this short period of time? Moreover, could you ensure that there would be no time clash for each classes, each student? Furthermore, even you could arrange so perfectly, 5-7 lessons, nearly a half of a module is concentrated into one month. Do you think it is suitable and reasonable? Even you could finish all the lessons, do you think students have enough time to understand the contents clearly, and have enough time to study and prepare for the examination in such short period of time? If so, I think you could shorten the coming semester.



Secondly, we are anger that why could an institution be so perfunctory that announcing cancelling all the lessons on 20 Nov and announcing resuming all the lessons on 26 Nov. I don’t think you guys take serious on students and the course and the reputation of IVE. Moreover, don’t you guys have foresight on the social circumstances these 6 months? We don’t think it would end up very soon. Would you announce cancelling the lessons in the coming week again? Please think before you make decisions!



Thirdly, we are part-time students. We need to work weekdays, even on Saturday and Sunday. We did consider how much time we could spend on the course to take modules. We decide a schedule for our work, for our life and for the course. We don’t mind spending spare some weekday nights, or even 1-2 Sunday for the make up classes. But please do not think that we could free our every public holiday for the course.


Finally, we know that it is a harsh time for Hong Kong, but not IVE. As IVE even could not provide the full version CCTV for 陳彥霖, we do condemn your inhuman handling and please give us an acceptable offer no matter taking video lessons, refund, reschedule the classes and examination, or give us a pass on all modules this semester.

quote.msg:
有個同學整左個template比大家投訴
大家可以參考並修改
send去你地科最大果個既email
要佢地知道唔係佢地話一就一，話二就二


Dear XXXXXX



I am a student of course XXXXX, I and my classmates got some questions on the remaining lessons and the examination.



First of all, we hear some rumours about the examination will be arranged as planned, in the beginning of January 2020. We doubt whether the cancelled and the remaining classes could be finished on time.



For the reasons of doubt, there’s around one month from tomorrow, 27 Nov 2019 to the beginning of Jan 2020, but there are 5-7 lessons left for most of the modules. And I suppose every single student takes 3-4 modules a semester. How could you, the top management arrange such a number of lessons in this short period of time? Moreover, could you ensure that there would be no time clash for each classes, each student? Furthermore, even you could arrange so perfectly, 5-7 lessons, nearly a half of a module is concentrated into one month. Do you think it is suitable and reasonable? Even you could finish all the lessons, do you think students have enough time to understand the contents clearly, and have enough time to study and prepare for the examination in such short period of time? If so, I think you could shorten the coming semester.



Secondly, we are anger that why could an institution be so perfunctory that announcing cancelling all the lessons on 20 Nov and announcing resuming all the lessons on 26 Nov. I don’t think you guys take serious on students and the course and the reputation of IVE. Moreover, don’t you guys have foresight on the social circumstances these 6 months? We don’t think it would end up very soon. Would you announce cancelling the lessons in the coming week again? Please think before you make decisions!



Thirdly, we are part-time students. We need to work weekdays, even on Saturday and Sunday. We did consider how much time we could spend on the course to take modules. We decide a schedule for our work, for our life and for the course. We don’t mind spending spare some weekday nights, or even 1-2 Sunday for the make up classes. But please do not think that we could free our every public holiday for the course.


Finally, we know that it is a harsh time for Hong Kong, but not IVE. As IVE even could not provide the full version CCTV for 陳彥霖, we do condemn your inhuman handling and please give us an acceptable offer no matter taking video lessons, refund, reschedule the classes and examination, or give us a pass on all modules this semester.
